revised_title: Chemical Analysis of Fluor Spar and Fluor Compounds
tldr: The author, Humphry Davy, conducted experiments on fluor spar and its chemical compounds. He explored the similarities between oxymuriatic and fluoric compounds and tested various hypotheses about the composition of fluoric acid. Davy concluded that fluoric acid is composed of hydrogen and a unique principle called fluorine, which is similar to chlorine. He also suggested that further research could lead to the separation of fluorine as a gaseous element.
